item.title: Daphne Caruana Galizia: Malta responsible for journalist death - inquiry
item.description: The results of an inquiry say officials could have prevented Daphne Caruana Galizia's 2017 murder.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton and Sebastian Vettel speak out over Hungary anti-LGBTQ+ law
item.description: Formula 1 drivers Lewis Hamilton and Sebastian Vettel speak out against Hungary's new anti-LGBTQ+ law before this weekend's grand prix.

item.title: Russian module mishap destabilises International Space Station
item.description: The ISS was pushed out of position after engines on a new Russian module unexpectedly fired up.

item.title: Migrant women and babies held in shocking conditions, MPs find
item.description: A group of MPs describes scenes at a Dover asylum unit as "wholly inappropriate" and a Covid risk.

item.title: Covid: Stalled Russian vaccines cause global anger
item.description: Deliveries of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine have fallen far below expectations.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Novak Djokovic thrashes Kei Nishikori to reach men's semi-finals
item.description: Novak Djokovic remains on course for a 'Golden Slam' after thrashing home hope Kei Nishikori to ease into the Olympic semi-finals.

item.title: UK already undergoing disruptive climate change
item.description: Last year was the third warmest, fifth wettest and eighth sunniest on record in the UK, scientists warn.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Roma child: 'My only goal is to finish school'
item.description: How one school in Croatia is working to improve education opportunities for Roma children like Kristina.

item.title: Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue and his love of Bugattis and Michael Jackson
item.description: Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue, tipped as Equatorial Guinea's next leader, is under sanctions in the UK and France.

item.title: 'Luxury' race will be among most expensive on earth
item.description: A four-day ultramarathon covering 120 miles on the west coast of Scotland will cost Â£15,499 to enter.

item.title: Extreme weather: What causes flash flooding?
item.description: Cities across the world are at risk of extreme rainfall overwhelming their streets

item.title: Covid passports: How do they work around the world?
item.description: How are countries enforcing vaccine passports and what can people use them for?

item.title: Tips from the Netherlands on how to build a nation of cyclists
item.description: Some tips from the Dutch Cycling Embassy on how to make bikes the easiest and safest way to travel.

item.title: I survived Norway's worst terror attack
item.description: Lisa Husby recalls hiding in fear as far-right extremist Anders Breivik went on a killing spree in 2011.

item.title: Europe floods: 'I have an axe beside my bed'
item.description: Marion Wenzel showed the BBC around her flood-wrecked house in Ahrweiler, Germany.

item.title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
item.description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

item.title: Horse racing: Inside the abattoir slaughtering racehorses
item.description: Campaign group Animal Aid set up covert cameras in one of the few slaughterhouses licensed to kill horses.
